intro: Lepidagathis ustulata, commonly known as the flame flower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa. It is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that resemble flames, which are typically borne in clusters. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often growing in coastal or rocky habitats.
